title: Matplotlib demo
text:
This page provides a quick demo of using quarto to execute python code (using the jupyter engine).
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Airquality analysis
text: This is a quick demo of a Quarto website where we’ll present airquality data. To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Airquality analysis
text:
Air Quality
Figure 1 further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.


Code
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess")





Figure 1: Temperature and ozone level.




The data for this analysis are shown below using the DT package in R, an interface to javascript datatables.


Code
library(DT)
datatable(airquality)
